flextable 0.9.11.022

Delete flextable columns

Source: R/augment_rows.R
delete_columns.Rd

The function removes one or more columns from a 'flextable'.

Usage

delete_columns(x, j = NULL)

Arguments

x

a 'flextable' object, see flextable-package to learn how to create 'flextable' object.

j

column selector, see section Column selection with the j parameter in <flextable column selection>.

Details

Deleting one or more columns will result in the deletion of any span parameters that may have been set previously. They will have to be redone after this operation or performed only after this deletion.

See also

Other functions for row and column operations in a flextable: add_body(), add_body_row(), add_footer(), add_footer_lines(), add_footer_row(), add_header(), add_header_lines(), add_header_row(), delete_part(), separate_header(), set_header_footer_df, set_header_labels()

Examples

ft <- flextable(head(iris))
ft <- delete_columns(ft, j = "Species")
ft

Sepal.Width
